page.title: 09Modern Industry, Wye Valley.
page.content: The water-powered mills of the past no longer operate in the area and this heralded the end of the wire-making and paper mill. Farming has always been an important industry here. The undulating nature of the land makes it unsuitable for crop growing, so farming has mainly involved raising dairy cows, pigs and sheep. Modern machinery has helped to make farms more efficient and fewer people are employed there. Tourism has become an important industry because of the beautiful countryside and places of interest which attract many people. Hotels, inns and restaurants cater for the needs of the tourists, bringing employment to local people. There are many leisure activities in the Wye Valley such as fishing, and walking.
